prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: A Three-Dimensional Geometric Shape with a Combination of Rectangular and Triangular Facets** **Step 1: Create a 2D Sketch** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles -90, 0, 0 and translation vector [0, 0.345, 0]. Draw a rectangle with corners at [0, 0] and [0.5175, 0.3019]. This rectangle consists of four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4) and one face (face\\_1). **Step 2: Scale the Sketch** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. **Step 3: Transform the Sketch into 3D** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector provided in the coordinate system. **Step 4: Extrude the Sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.345 units to create a 3D model. The final shape has dimensions: length - 0.75, width - 0.345, and height - 0.75. **Details of the Curves, Loops and Faces:** Face\\_1: Loop\\_1: Line\\_1: Start Point - [0,0], End Point - [0.5175, 0] Line\\_2: Start Point - [0.5175, 0], End Point - [0.5175, 0.3019] Line\\_3: Start Point - [0.5175, 0.3019], End Point - [0, 0.3019] Line\\_4: Start Point - [0, 0.3019], End Point - [0, 0] Face\\_2: Loop\\_1: Line\\_1: Start Point - [0, 0.3019], End Point - [0.5175, 0.3019] Line\\_2: Start Point - [0.5175, 0.3019], End Point - [0.2587, 0.75] Line\\_3: Start Point - [0.2587, 0.75], End Point - [0, 0.3019] Note: The final shape is a combination of rectangular and triangular facets, created by the extrusion of the 2D sketch. The shape does not require any boolean operation with previous bodies, as it is being constructed as a standalone part.</description>

prompt: <description>**Construction Instructions** The following instructions outline the process for constructing the final shape described in the given JSON data. We will be creating a single parametric CAD model composed of one intermediate CAD part. <part\\_1> **Creating the Base CAD Part** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles and translation vector all set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. **Creating the Sketch** For the base CAD part, create the sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. Perform the following steps: 1. Create a new face and name it `face_1`. Within `face_1`, create the following loops: 1. Create the first loop, `loop_1`: i. Create a circle centered at [0.375, 0.375] with a radius of 0.375. 2. Create the second loop, `loop_2`: i. Create a circle centered at [0.1484, 0.6309] with a radius of 0.0185. 3. Create the third loop, `loop_3`: i. Create a circle centered at [0.608, 0.125] with a radius of 0.0185. **Extruding the Sketch** For the base part, we will extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model: 1. Set the `extrude_depth_towards_normal` value to 0.0738 and `extrude_depth_opposite_normal` to 0.0. 2. Apply a sketch scale factor of 0.75. 3. Perform the extrusion to complete the parametric CAD model for this part. With the provided JSON, the dimensions of the intermediate CAD part and the final shape are as follows: - `part_1`: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.75 * Height: 0.0738 - Final shape: * Height: 0.0738 * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.75 The above instructions provide a detailed breakdown of every curve, loop, and face needed for the construction of each part and the final shape. It includes the number of curves where applicable, and uses clear, concise language with an imperative tone to guide a junior CAD designer through the process of building the desired parametric CAD model.</description>

<description>Part 1 Instructions 1.1 Create the base coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system for the first part with the following properties: * Euler angles: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) * Translation vector: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0087) 1.2 Generate the 2D sketch For the base part, generate a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the created coordinate system with the following details: * The sketch has one face. * The face contains one loop. * The loop consists of four lines, each with the following start and end points: Loop 1: * Line 1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) * Line 2: (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.75) * Line 3: (0.75, 0.75) to (0.0, 0.75) * Line 4: (0.0, 0.75) to (0.0, 0.0) 1.3 Transform the sketch to 3D Using the coordinate system defined above: * Set the euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and the translation vector to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0087). * Transform the 2D sketch to a 3D sketch. 1.4 Extrude the sketch Now, extrude the 2D sketch to create a 3D solid model with the following details: * Extrude the depth opposite the normal direction with a depth of 0.0087. * Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 for the sketch. * Perform the operation to create a new solid body. This first part is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at a right angle, and the dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units with the length of 0.75 units, width of 0.75 units, and height of 0.0087 units. Continue to generate similar instructions for the remaining parts in the CAD assembly JSON list, ensuring that you follow the provided format and guidelines.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole Step 1: Create a New Coordinate System initiate a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Step 2: Draw the 2D Sketch for the Rectangular Prism - Start by creating a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. - Draw a rectangle using lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0056, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.0056, 0.0], End Point [0.0056, 0.0281] - Line 3: Start Point [0.0056, 0.0281], End Point [0.0, 0.0281] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0281], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Step 3: Scale the 2D Sketch - Scale the 2D sketch uniformly by a factor of 0.0281. Step 4: Transform the 2D Sketch to 3D - Apply a 3D rotation to the sketch using the Euler angles from the coordinate system. - Apply a translation to the sketch using the translation vector from the coordinate system. Step 5: Extrude the Sketch to Create the Rectangular Prism - Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by a depth of 0.75 units. - Set the operation to "create a new solid body". Step 6: Draw the 2D Sketch for the Cylindrical Hole - Start a new sketch on the top face of the rectangular prism. - Draw a circle centered at the origin with a radius of (0.0056 / 2). Step 7: Extrude the Sketch to Create the Cylindrical Hole - Extrude the circle sketch through the rectangular prism by a depth of 0.75 units. - Set the operation to "subtract material from the existing body". dimensions: - Height of the rectangular prism: 0.0281 - Width of the rectangular prism: 0.75 - Height of the cylindrical hole: 0.75 - Diameter of the cylindrical hole: 0.0056 (or a radius of 0.0028)</description>
